articles.title: About
articles.contents:
Contents
Professional
Personal
Contact


Professional
Worked as a biologist and wetland scientist for over 7 years in the
private and non-profit sectors. I’m a master’s student in the MEDS
program at UCSB where my capstone work focuses on predicting crop yields
in sub-Saharan Africa by combining satellite imagery and machine
learning.
Personal
East coast transplant (Massachusetts) living in beautiful Santa
Barbara, California. I don’t have much free time as a current student,
but when I do you can find me botanizing the Santa Ynez Mountains 
,
playing pick-up soccer, or kite surfing the point at Leadbetter
Beach.
Contact
Interested in chatting? Feel free to contact me on email, Twitter, or LinkedIn. I’m open to work opportunities and look
forward to hearing from you!

articles.title: Steven Cognac
articles.contents:
https://cognack.github.io



 1620 Laguna Street, Santa Barbara, CA 93101 |
 scognac@bren.ucsb.edu | 
978-835-0699 


 I am a wetland scientist and plant
biologist with six years of experience supporting ecological
restoration, environmental permitting/planning, and implementing rare
and invasive plant monitoring programs. I have experience conducting
functional wetland assessments, jurisdictional delineations,
protocol-level rare plant monitoring, and vegetation type mapping. As an
enabler of the climate crisis at hand, I’m working to bridge the science
communication gap between industry and the public. 

Education
 University of California Santa Barbara,
Bren School of Environmental Science and Management 2021-2022 Master of Environmental Data
Science (MEDS) Candidate
University of Massachusetts Amherst 2010-2014 B.S. in Environmental Science
and Sustainable Food & Farming 
Research Experience
 Graduate Research Assistant
Sept 2019 - Jan 2020Everglades Wetland Research Park, Naples FL
Aided pilot development of a GIS-based wetland restoration model
aimed at targeting restoration hot-spots in the historic extent of the
Great Black Swamp region in Ohio.
Researched storm pulsing controls and it’s effect on the dynamics of
the hydrologic budget and water quality parameters within a tropical
constructed stormwater wetland.

Professional
Experience
 BiologistJan 2019 - May 2021WRA,
Inc. Emeryville, California
Collaborate with clients on environmental regulatory compliance for
development, biological community restoration, water quality, and
biological monitoring projects. Lead natural resource assessments
including wetland delineations, special-status species surveys,
vegetation mapping, water quality monitoring and analysis, and
biological monitoring.
Manage permitting processes with agencies such as U.S. Army Corps of
Engineers (Corps), California’s Regional Water Quality Control Boards,
California Department of Fish and Wildlife, and the California Coastal
Commission (CCC).
Collaborate with project stakeholders, botanists, wildlife
biologists, landscape architects, and engineers to aggregate and
quantify information for technical and resource assessment reports.
Wetland Scientist/Environmental AnalystJune 2014 - June 2017Vanasse
Hangen Brustlin, Inc. Watertown, Massachusetts
Developed environmental permit applications in support of
engineering projects for state and local transportation agencies and
private development clients.
Performed natural resource surveys including wetland and stream
delineations, invasive species mapping, habitat assessments,
stormwater/groundwater monitoring, and wetland assessments.
Prepared technical reports including wetland and vernal pool
functional assessments, habitat evaluations, and alternative assessments
using ArcGIS to support Corps, MA Wetlands Protection Act, NEPA, and
Endangered Species Act applications.
Analyzed MassDOT Highway transportation project plans/scopes of work
to identify, document, and administer environmental compliance
pertaining to federal/state environmental permitting.
Wetland Field TechnicianApril 2016 - Sept 2016Midwest
Biodiversity Institute, Hilliard, Ohio
Executed EPA field sampling protocols at over 65 sites throughout
the eastern seaboard for the 2016 National Wetland Condition
Assessment.
Analyzed and collected hydric soil and water samples, conducted
botanical inventories, characterized hydrology, and led disposition of
samples.
Handled site reconnaissance, landowner and agency coordination, and
pre-sample site visits to determine presence/absence of hydric soil
and/or wetland flora.

Skills and Certifications
 Software: ESRI ArcGIS, R,
Python, Trimble Pathfinder, Google Earth Pro.
Field Skills and Equipment Management: Corps wetland
delineation, botanical dichotomous keys, Trimble GPS (GeoExplorer), YSI
ProDSS/EXO2, data loggers, pressure sensors, IRGS (LI-6400XT), soil
augers 
Certifications: 40-HR HAZWOPER, Basic Wetland
Delineation, First Aid/CPR, SCUBA Open Water 
Volunteer Experience
 2017 – 2018: New England
Wildflower Society, Plant Conservation Volunteer Program. Conduct
surveys of rare and endangered species within Massachusetts.2019 – 2020: Jepson Herbarium curatorial volunteer.
Mounting Rancho Santa Ana Botanic Garden specimens from the Flora of LA
collection.2020 - 2021: East Bay California
Native Plant Society’s rare plant monitor for the Rare, Unusual, and
Significant Plants of Alameda and Contra Costa Counties
Program
